title: 8 tips for an eco-friendly kitchen remodel, according to pros | - Homes & Gardens
summary: The article discusses eco-friendly practices and recommendations for sustainably remodeling a kitchen, emphasizing the importance of using durable materials, low VOC paints, and incorporating old-world pieces to reduce environmental impact. Experts provide insights on making choices that are both stylish and sustainable, highlighting methods to conserve resources and reduce waste in the remodeling process.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article outlines various sustainable practices and materials that contribute to environmental sustainability during kitchen remodeling, which aligns with the goals of reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: FALSE, because while it discusses sustainable home remodeling practices, it does not specifically introduce a new or improved product or business process that significantly differs from previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE, because the article promotes the use of low VOC paints, reclaimed materials, and other sustainable products in kitchen remodeling, which are designed to reduce their environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE, because the article details sustainable practices for kitchen remodeling that minimize environmental impact, such as reusing materials and choosing energy-efficient appliances.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 236118 - Residential Remodelers, 321999 - All Other Miscellaneous Wood Product Manufacturing, 325510 - Paint and Coating Manufacturing, 423220 - Home Furnishing Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article promotes genuine sustainable practices and does not make misleading claims about the environmental benefits of the discussed products or processes.
